TURNED IT AROUND.Definition: turned it in the opposite direction

TERM.Definition: the word used to describe the concept of fake news

POSTERBOY.Definition: the person who is most famous for something

TACTIC.Definition: a planned way of doing something

DOUBT.Definition: the feeling of not being certain about something

REFLECT WELL ON.Definition: give good evidence on the qualities of someone

CLAIMING.Definition: saying that something is the case

DISINFORMATION.Definition: information that is presented in a wrong way on purpose

MISLEAD.Definition: cause people to have a wrong idea about something

DISTINGUISH.Definition: notice the difference between two things

WOMANISER.Definition: a man who engages in a lot of casual sexual affairs

SPREAD.Definition: reached or were known in a wide area

UNSUITABILITY.Definition: the quality of not being right or appropriate for a particular position

CONGREGATION.Definition: a group of people who had come together to pray in a church

TORTURED.Definition: made to experience great physical pain

BURNT AT THE STAKE.Definition: burnt on a wooden post as punishment

PAMPHLETS.Definition: small books with a few pages that give information about something

ANTI-SEMITIC.Definition: showing extreme dislike for or hostility to Jews

OBSTACLE.Definition: something that prevents something from happening

PURPOSE.Definition: the reason for which something is done

DERIVES.Definition: has its root or origins in something

AMUSE.Definition: cause someone to find something funny and laugh

TELESCOPE.Definition: a device using lenses or mirrors for making distant objects appear larger and nearer

DID WONDERS FOR.Definition: had a very good effect on

INDICATION.Definition: something that shows and makes something clear

RUN UP.Definition: the period before an important event

SHOCKS.Definition: causes people to be surprised or upset

BASIS.Definition: a fact or circumstance on which something is built or established

TROLL FARMS.Definition: organised groups of people whose aim is to spread fake news

DISTRUST.Definition: a feeling of not trusting someone or something

ATTRIBUTED.Definition: be considered as a result of

DEEP FAKES.Definition: faked computer generated videos or audio clips that are made to look and sound like someone

CREEPY.Definition: strange and making you feel frightened

DISTINGUISHING.Definition: recognise something as different from something else

DECEIVE.Definition: causing them to believe that something false is the truth for their own advantage

BLURRY.Definition: not able to be seen clearly
